line_1: And courteous haviour gent and debonair,
line_2: The rich and noble from all parts repair,

line_1: And courteous haviour gent and debonair,
line_2: They cast to imitate such semblaunce fair;

line_1: And courteous haviour gent and debonair,
line_2: Their own rough virtues they disdain to wear,

line_1: She, that at Bath, so debonair,
line_2: Sung gallant Damon and his fair,

line_1: By making all our Spirits Debonair,
line_2: Throws off the Lees, the Sediment of Care.

line_1: She deffly pac'd elong so debonair:
line_2: Thus fabling they: mean while the damsel fair
Still humm'd a new Italian air;

line_1: And their daughters are beauteous, and sons debonair:
line_2: For, believe me, they live not unbless'd with good air,
"WITH prudence choose a wife" — Be thy first care
And Temper mild, thy joys and griefs to share;
